facts.1: National Sewing Machine Day celebrates the invention of the sewing machine, which revolutionized the textile industry.
facts.2: The first functional sewing machine was invented by French tailor Barthelemy Thimonnier in 1830.
facts.3: Sewing machines have evolved over the years, with modern machines offering advanced features like computerized stitching and embroidery.

facts.1: International Axe Throwing Day is celebrated by enthusiasts who enjoy the sport of throwing axes at targets.
facts.2: The day promotes the growth of axe throwing as a recreational activity and competitive sport.
facts.3: Axe throwing has gained popularity in recent years, with many venues offering axe throwing lanes and leagues.

facts.1: National Weed Your Garden Day encourages gardeners to take time to remove weeds from their gardens.
facts.2: Weeding helps to maintain the health of garden plants by reducing competition for nutrients, water, and sunlight.
facts.3: Regular weeding can prevent the spread of invasive plants and improve the overall appearance of the garden.
